Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Model
Description: Model of a hoe fashioned from a single clump of clay. An elongated section represents the handle, the curved and flat extremity depicts the blade. The hoe was one of the essential tools used during the foundation ritual. It was used to dig the foundation trench once the plan of the temple had been drawn.
